newsitem.title: USA: U.S. Plains fed cattle market quiet - feedlots.
newsitem.headline: U.S. Plains fed cattle market quiet - feedlots.

text.p: U.S. Plains feedlot cattle markets were extremely quiet, with no sales reported, feedlot sources said.
Packer bids were scattered at $66.00 per cwt, with owners asking $68.00 to $69.00, they said.

Cattle were expected to trade steady with last week at $67.00, once sales begin. Outlooks for firmer values were dimmed by falling beef prices this week and a severe storm on the East Coast which was seen cutting into beef demand.
The storm that swept through New England Monday could curb beef demand because of closed roads and power outages.
